p: Figure 1 shows the crystal structure of an orthorhombic PrBaCo 2O 5.5. The structure of PrBaCo 2O 5.5 is modeled by doubling the mother material PrBaCo 2O 6 with an oxygen vacancy. Along the (001) crystal direction in the oxide, the Pr–O and the Ba–O atomic layers are alternately ordered, and the Co–O atomic layers are positioned between the Pr–O and the Ba–O layers. There are two types of cobalt ions, Co Oct and Co Py, in PrBaCo 2O 5.5 due to the presence of oxygen vacancy, while only Co Oct exists in PrBaCo 2O 6.
